meanings.definition: To cut short or reduce in duration.
meanings.sent1: She curtailed her speech to make it shorter.
meanings.sent2: The movie was curtailed to fit into a one-hour time slot.
meanings.sent3: The magician curtailed his show, leaving the audience wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The teacher curtailed the lesson like a pair of scissors cutting paper.
meanings.sent5: The storm curtailed our picnic, forcing us to seek shelter.

meanings.sent1: The new rules curtailed our freedom to play outside.
meanings.sent2: The budget cuts curtailed our ability to travel for vacation.
meanings.sent3: The strict diet curtailed his cravings for sweets.
meanings.sent4: The fence curtailed the dog's access to the garden.
meanings.sent5: The lock curtailed access to the treasure chest.
